summary: Email chain between attorney Teri Gibbs and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004. The emails discuss travel arrangements and video conference logistics for the interviews, and mention attached photographs of the clients from 2004 for identification purposes.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney coordinating interviews for two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004. She communicates with the prosecutor's office regarding scheduling and logistics.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Copied on emails to help coordinate travel arrangements for one of the alleged victims.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Identified as the New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims to her interview.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Copied on initial email from Teri Gibbs regarding the victim reports.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). Two clients allege they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

connections.description: Gibbs identifies Fudali as the New York attorney who will accompany a client to an interview, indicating a professional legal association.
Gibbs and Mullen are coordinating travel and logistics for a client's interview with prosecutors.
Gibbs is representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with him.

events.title: Alleged assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of attorney Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial attorney call with prosecutor
events.description: Teri Gibbs's firm spoke with a federal prosecutor regarding their clients' allegations against Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled in-person victim interview
events.description: Scheduled interview for one alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) with prosecutors at their office.

events.title: Scheduled video conference victim interview
events.description: Scheduled video conference interview for another alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) who is located in Japan.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York office)
keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are identified, with assaults alleged to have occurred in or around June 2004.
The victims' attorneys provided photographs from 2004 to prosecutors and asked if the victims appeared in photos seized from Epstein's home.
Interviews were scheduled for August 26-27, 2019, with one victim in-person and one via video conference from Japan.
The communication is part of criminal case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) against Jeffrey Epstein.
The document shows the logistical coordination between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York.
